bill_title: Honoring Clark Wold as the 2004 GEORGE Award Recipient for the City of Aberdeen, South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Clark Wold as the 2004 GEORGE Award Recipient for the City of Aberdeen, South Dakota. WHEREAS, Clark Wold works with the Chamber of Commerce's Leadership Aberdeen program and is committed to keeping our young adults in the community and State of South Dakota; and WHEREAS, Clark Wold has been involved in numerous projects and programs, including board member of the North Plains Hospice, member of the Aberdeen Parking Board, member of Avera St. Luke's Hospital and Foundation Board, volunteer youth soccer coach, board member of Good Shepherd Lutheran Church, YMCA Board of Directors, United Way Rails Club member, and member of the Mapping Your Future CEO Board; and WHEREAS, Clark Wold has been the recipient of both the Rocky Mountain Association of Student Financial Aid Administrators Hall of Fame and Distinguished Service Awards and was inducted into the Jamestown College Alumni Hall of Fame: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eightieth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Clark Wold, a respected resident of the City of Aberdeen, be recognized and congratulated for receiving the 2004 GEORGE Award.

A LEGISLATIVE COMMEMORATION, Honoring Clark Wold as the 2004 GEORGE Award Recipient for the City of Aberdeen, South Dakota. WHEREAS, Clark Wold works with the Chamber of Commerce's Leadership Aberdeen program and is committed to keeping our young adults in the community and State of South Dakota; and WHEREAS, Clark Wold has been involved in numerous projects and programs, including board member of the North Plains Hospice, member of the Aberdeen Parking Board, member of Avera St. Luke's Hospital and Foundation Board, volunteer youth soccer coach, board member of Good Shepherd Lutheran Church, YMCA Board of Directors, United Way Rails Club member, and member of the Mapping Your Future CEO Board; and WHEREAS, Clark Wold has been the recipient of both the Rocky Mountain Association of Student Financial Aid Administrators Hall of Fame and Distinguished Service Awards and was inducted into the Jamestown College Alumni Hall of Fame: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT COMMEMORATED, by the Eightieth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, that Clark Wold, a respected resident of the City of Aberdeen, be recognized and congratulated for receiving the 2004 GEORGE Award.
